basics.name: Tom Fleet
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a highly motivated, logical, detail-oriented and enthusiastic developer with a background in aerospace engineering and materials science. I taught myself to code during the lockdown of 2020 starting with python, bash, go and SQL. I am a well rounded, competent, professional software developer with a broad range of competencies, my specialities are python, Go, machine learning, data analysis, backend web development, REST APIs and microservices. In my spare time I’m learning Rust and have plans to learn Typescript in the near future. I have also open sourced a few projects, and am an active open source contributor and maintainer.

work.name: Junkshon
work.summary: Backend Python/Django developer split between backend development/maintenance and the implementation of machine learning feature sets on a proprietary web-based platform designed to facilitate cloud migrations.
highlights: Development and deployment of text classification microservices via AWS Lambda and Openfaas. Also created a robust and reusable “cookiecutter” template for such services.
Maintaining a large enterprise Django application, addressing bugs, implementing new API endpoints to expose to a react frontend, refactoring as necessary.
Took on a more dev ops focused role involving deployment of key infrastructure and applications on Azure.
Successfully completed AWS Cloud Practitioner and Azure fundamentals training.

work.name: Alvant Ltd
work.summary: Key member of a small technical team working in the advanced materials/manufacturing sector.
highlights: Installing and setting up a local SQL database to auto-log manufacturing machine data, later migrating to a cloud hosted database.
Developed and open sourced a python package to automate and enhance the analysis of mechanical test data.
Created a python package to analyse and report on project timesheet data for the financial team using pandas and streamlit.
Developed a python package to automate the validation and verification of a manufacturing machine cycle using a combination of pandas and sqlalchemy.

work.name: GE Aviation Systems
work.description: Global aerospace engine and structures manufacturer
work.summary: Member of the Materials & Processes team working on the Airbus A350 Composite Trailing Edge.
highlights: Heavily involved in elimination of process control test pieces through extremely thorough statistical analysis of historical data.
Established and proved the source of recurring defects in acrylic canopy moulding through rigorous analysis of historic archive data (dating back to 1973).
Developed a system for calculating minimum acceptance criteria for a complex mechanical test by using locally-estimated data smoothing.

publications.name: Modelling of the Overcasting Reinforcement Process using the LS-DYNA ® ICFD Solver
publications.summary: Innovative use of CFD models combined with liquid metal crystallisation and genetic algorithms in order to predict liquid-solid aluminium bonding to a composite insert.

publications.name: A Machine Learning Approach to Model Interdependencies between Dynamic Response and Crack Propagation
publications.summary: Application of machine learning techniques to thermo-mechanical fatigue damage prediction in aerospace materials.
